ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take it only if you're interested in the topic. Workload is pretty light too
Highly recommended. Fun course (a lot of reading, but skim it.. you don't actually HAVE to do it) with lots of pertinent information on how our current economic system works. Lots of food for thought

Great class! As an Economics major, definitely got a chance to learn about a completely different way of looking at social issues and evaluating them. Professor Wherry is awesome and suuuuper helpful in understanding some of the complex ideas, and even giving direction when it comes to additional readings or career advice.

SOCY 321 is a social analysis of markets and deals with how markets are created, propped up, and made to function based on individuals, social norms, and government agencies ideas of what the market and the social should look like.Would absolutely recommend this class to anyone interested in how markets work beyond the crazy numbers and X graphs that made you drop intro macro.
